intro: Juncus acutiflorus var. repens, commonly known as the creeping rush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland environments in North America. It has slender, cylindrical stems that grow close to the ground, often forming dense mats. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of greenish-white flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense clusters at the base. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
